= null =

== Syntax ==
Constant: '''null'''

== Description ==
The '''null''' keyword represents a null pointer value in DIL, indicating a pointer does not point to any valid object.

== Usage Notes ==
* '''null''' can be used with any pointer type (unitptr, extraptr, cmdptr, etc.)
* Many functions return '''null''' to indicate failure or that no object was found
* '''null''' is commonly used as a parameter in functions like '''act()''' where a medium argument is optional
* When comparing pointers, use `== null` or `!= null` to check for null values

== Examples ==
 dilbegin check_for_item();
 var
    my_unit : unitptr;
 code
 {
    my_unit := findunit(self, "sword", FIND_UNIT_INVEN, null);
    if (my_unit == null)
    {
       act("You don't have a sword.", A_ALWAYS, self, null, null, TO_CHAR);
    }
 } dilend

 dilbegin use_null_parameter();
 code
 {
    act("You look around.", A_SOMEONE, self, null, null, TO_CHAR);
 } dilend

== Error Handling ==
When working with functions that return pointers, always check for '''null''' before using the returned value to avoid runtime errors:

 if (returned_pointer != null)
 {
    // Safe to use the pointer
 }
 else
 {
    // Handle the null case
 }
